reviewText: OK. I gotta admit that it was his looks that got me into his music.I don't really care much for country music. I don't hate it it's just not my taste. I like one or two songs here and there. A friend of mine bought one of his CD for me (Modern day drifter). She knew that I thought he was the cutest. I started listening to it in my car. After couple times I started to get into it and I eventually ended up liking it alot. I went out and bought his first CD and ended falling in love with couple songs on that CD. When his third CD came out I bought it right away without hesitation. I was really surprised that he's  just getting better on every CD that he puts out. It's even better than Modern day drifter CD.When I found out that he will have his DVD out I put in preorder right away. Now I fell in love with him even more. In special behind the scenes on the DVD was very good. We get to see the real him. He seems so normal, not acting like he was a big superstar and that's made him more unique than everybody else. He looks like someone who live next door to you that just love to sing and make good music.If you don't have his third CD. Get it. You'll love it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: THE MUSIC ON THIS DVD IS GOOD. THE VIDEO PORTION WILL GIVE YOU MOTION SICKNESS. THE VIDEO EDITING IS TERRIBLE.IT'S SO CHOPPY THAT EACH SCENEIS ABOUT 1 TO 2 SECONDS.IT STILL AMAZES ME THAT IN THIS DAY AND AGE WE STILL HAVE A TON OF VIDEO EDITORS THAT THINK THAT 50 DIFFERENT CAMERA ANGLES EVEY MINUTE MAKES FOR A WATCHABLE SHOW. IF YOU LIKE THAT KIND OF CONCERT FILMING, THEN THIS SHOW IS FOR YOU.
summary: MUSIC IS GOOD BUT HARD TO WATCH.............
Title: N/A

reviewText: This Dierks Bentley DVD is the next best thing than seeing him in concert.I saw him on the tour last Summer and after seeing it as well as this I'd say it is the next best thing.Ive never seen another Country concert DVD put together exactly like this. The photography is great and the music is great! If you like the music of Dierks Bentley I think you'll like this. He does all his hits from his first two cds as well as other songs.
summary: Country Concert Film at it's best
Title: N/A

reviewText: While nothing beats the experience of a live Dierks Bentley concert, this video captures the best elements and is the second best thing.  The concert features many of his big hits like "What Was I Thinkin?", "Come a Little Closer" and "Lot of Leavin' Left to Do" as well as some album cuts and some covers (including "Folsom Prison Blues" and even a bit of "Tiger By the Tail").  True fans have come to expect a Bluegrass inspired poriton of the concert and will not be disappointed.The bonus footage includes live interviews of the band and crew as well as a guest appearance by Jake (trusted mascot and star of album covers and videos).This is a great concert video you will want to watch over and over again.
summary: A Treasure for any Dierks Bentley Fan!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a brilliant 'live & loud' performance DVD by Bentley and crew.  Althought I can't for all intents and purposes state it makes you feel like you were in attendance, there is an unassuming sincerity that compliments the fervent joyfulness of a live DB performance.Bentley is a blend of deep-rooted country graciousness fused with a stanch and dedicated admiration and thanks for and to his audience that is striking when combined with his contemporary songwriting abilities and renderings.The sound is outstanding.The set is perfection.The crowd is rowdy and with him, making for a darn perfect interaction.The extras are genuine Bentley...though, longer would have been better.
Title: N/A
